author: ihelper
title: Dapp for recycling value chain
description: トークンやスマートコントラクトを使って、Cardanoコミュニティがどのようにリサイクル♻️のインセンティブを与え、個々のコレクターの収入を高めることができるか？

f6_assessments.q0: I think this idea is very well thought out and could be part of helping to solve the global issue of waste and recycling. It seems to fit into the challenge as being a deployable dapp by a new team that has a token that would create a measurable TVL but I have a little bit of hesitancy as to wether or not this can be defined as a DeFi project as per the challenge. Potential Directions listed in the challenge brief are things like DEX's, stable coins, borrowing/lending apps, etc. I'm not willing to say it doesn't fit because there are varying notions of how DeFi can be defined but I'm substracting one star for this reason.
f6_assessments.q1: I feel very confident that this proposal could be implemented successfully. A list of team members along with Linkedin profiles and credentials is listed. The competency level of the team seems high. The budget is clearly defined and very reasonable. Timetable is given and is manageable. Necessary resources are provided and I think it's great that they have utilized the proposal tool!
f6_assessments.q2: Auditing this proposal should be easy becasue of all the time the team has put into identifying milestones within a strong and clear roadmap. KPI is given. An identified problem with a solution is clearly articulated. This is one of the most comprehensive and clearly stated proposals I have read on Catalyst. Well done!

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is impressive on so many levels! Not only is it a shining example of translating the current criteria for a high quality proposal into a user-friendly, readable format, it has made my job as a CA easy to identify and assess Impact, Feasibility, & Auditability. 
*Impact on Cardano: As articulated under the title "Why Cardano?" and clearly identified who this proposal will impact under: "Stakeholder identification, this proposal not only impacts off chain issues & solutions, the Cardano blockchain, and the Project Catalyst community, it takes impact to a whole new level by addressing climate change & contributes in a real & meaningful way to fulfilling Cardano's mission of "Making the World Work Better for ALL." 
*Impact on Challenge Metrics & Goals: The challenge asks the question: How to encourage new teams to Deploy Defi Solutions on Cardano? This proposal fits into 1) the goal of "This challenge intends to sow new teams... value to the community," AND they have managed to "form a community in order to gain competitiveness/sustainability." They have collected a team within the project and they have connected to communities across Project Catalyst. The key metrics & goals of the proposal align with the outlined challenge settings as indicated succinctly below the title "What success looks like?" This proposal has a budget well below the maximum $50K, a team AND a community both off & on chain to support and promote their impactful work through the creation of a D'App on Cardano & 12 month goal to produce a "Peer reviewed research paper". 
*Scale: By co-creating and "Reaching Cardano DAO Level 3 in one year," they will have the framework to meet future challenges as a Decentralized Autonomous Organization. I believe the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges. 
*Impact on the UN Sustainability Development Goals (SDGs): As indicated through their use of the SDGs proposal tool https://cardanocataly.st/proposer-tool-sdg/ made by Catalyst Community to assist in mapping our impact to the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals. 
Thank you to this team for taking the time and making the effort to create a clear & understandable proposal. 
(6) I most strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge and goes one step further by their efforts to impact climate change.
f6_assessments.q1:
Feasibility

*Skills, Experience & Team: The proposer provides evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the practical portion of the proposal. They have identified the essential building blocks and infrastructure on the Cardano blockchain needed to deliver on the project scope and they have indicated they are "seeking" a Cardano Blockchain specialist & accountant. 

Note: It is possible that the information regarding a Cardano blockchain specialist on board as a team member, or the indication of technical advice in the creation of this proposal is contained in the GitHub document. The average voter may or may not have the ability or time to navigate this platform (I do not). In my opinion, having this spelled out in off-chain user language could help improve the readability of this proposal.

* Budget Amount, Additional Funding, Timeline & Plan: The budget is within the goals of the challenge and may be reasonable to achieve the set goals. I strongly believe the proposers have the ability to work out future funding as the need arises because they are solution-oriented & connected to the wider community. I am neither an accountant nor familiar with the time it takes to complete the outlined tasks nor if the milestones are attainable. I am unable to verify whether or not the individual amounts are reasonable, conservative, or insufficient to accomplish the goals of the proposal. What is crystal clear to me is the first steps in the right direction to impacting the environment and the creation of a new model around incentivizing the collection of recyclables.

* Resources & Technical Feasibility: The proposal team has identified the building blocks & technologies on the Cardano blockchain needed to deliver on the project scope under "Solution Design". I do not have the technical background to confirm the legitimacy/accuracy of this information.

* Challenges & Risks: identified under "Risk identification." 

I am unable to rate the technical aspects of this proposal so my rating would be (4) IF I did not think outside the box, challenge the status quo & consider the impact of this proposal outweighing my personal shortcomings in understanding blockchain technologies, I am "borrowing the extra star from the Impact criteria. I feel this proposal is too important to fail based on my life experience.

(5) is my overall rating for feasibility: It is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully with passionate members of the Project Catalyst & Cardano4Climate community behind this team to help fill in any gaps that may or may not exist.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditability

My opinion of & support for this proposal is clear. As I am in the process of learning the language of project management and still unsure of the terms KPI, Metrics & what success looks like, I may not have fully captured the requirements for these concepts & "proven" this is an auditable proposal.

* Roadmap: as indicated in my assessment of this proposal for feasibility, through no fault of the proposal team, I do not have the experience nor knowledge to rate their roadmap. It appears to me to be logical & well-though out.

* Metrics – KPIs: are succinct & listed below the statement, "Success means for us creating value for the Cardano community through the experiment of building a Dapp that has social, economic, and environmental impact. Practically, for the foreseeable future, success lays on delivering the intermediary goals ..."

* Problem Description: Why? "Every hour, an estimated 2.5 million plastic bottles are thrown [out]." The challenge? "How can the Cardano community incentivize recycling and enhance individual collectors' income using Tokens and Smart Contracts?"

* Solution Description: What? "Add value to recycling supply chain by providing trail of evidence, liquidity, and a free market for tokenized used plastic bottles." How? "Our proposal aims to explore a sustainable business model and practical implementation of a DApp on Cardano that incentivize individual and collective collectors/recyclers by providing liquidity and enforcing traceability of recycled materials."

(5) I strongly agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information within their "Working Plan" to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

At the rate I write assessments, it is quite possible that I will run out of time before the 5pm UTC deadline to "rate" all the proposal I want/need to. I can let the pressure of this expectation go because, as a community advisor, a passionate supporter of the experiment called "Project Catalyst" and an active member of Cardano4Climate, I know beyond a shadow of a doubt that we are headed in the right direction(s). "Climate Change is a failure of cooperation"- Scott Poynton. Together, WE will not fail. In the meantime, my hope is that you, the voter, will read this proposal for yourself, connect to the problem & support the solution to this challenge with your voice and voting power.

f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is well written and detailed shows a lot of knowledge in the subject as well as a lot of thought that put into it. As a mentor for early-stage startups in developing countries, this proposal/pitch is well presented. 

Seems like a great team with Linkedin links and complimentary required experience. 
It will be helpful to have a bit more details regarding: "We have real-world experience in recycling in Africa". This is some reference for it with the list of collaborations. Speaking of such seems like a very relevant list of partnerships within the community (Cardano4Climate) and several other organizations.  
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and seems very reasonable and a bit on the low side. From my experience as an entrepreneur, probably more funds will be needed going forward. It would have been good to provide more information about future funding plans either through Catalyst or through other sources or business models.  
The proposal clearly explains technical aspects and development flow relevant for the implementation.
The proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a good list of measurable concert KPIs and which will be possible to audit. This is great but from my experience as an entrepreneur for 20 years, consider what will be the top 3 KPIs to focus on, and then you can mention the rest as sub-KPIs. 

"What success looks like" is also mentioned in detail as well as clear milestones for 3,6, and 12 months. It is also very good that the KPIs include specific estimations such as the number of users and bottles collected. The community will be able to follow up on the progress and the actual impact.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an interesting idea that I believe will drive a lot of people to adopt because of its mechanism and gamification in the dApp. Throughout why the project chooses Cardano, key metrics and detail about how it works to attract people to use it. I think it will have a huge effect on the development of Cardano community, I can see the future in the number of their goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has shown a very detailed implementation plan that includes technology, the journey of a bottle in a recycling circle, and its digital twin... better, the proposer shows the outline of all the packages of working plan that will be available within the plan and things this project will deliver... 
That all helps to make sense of the roadmap. Based on these infos above, the budget he required is absolutely reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer shows us a detailed roadmap and timelines that are realistic to do. Moreover, KPIs in the timeline is so promising and detailed that they all help it easy to audit this project. 
Moreover, they have a good awareness about the problem and explain well how their project can help to solve that. So that's the reason why they identify well about the potential risk they will meet when implementing this project. 
Hope that they can make this project successful to help this world better.

f6_assessments.q0:
The subject is very well presented and the issue, related to the challenge, is clear and easy to understand. 
A good explanation of the process in the paragraph on "The journey of a bottle and its digital twin". This shows how the solution makes it possible to solve the problem posed. 
The proposal sets out development areas, in particular with the possibility of issuing carbon credits
I like the pragmatic approach which as well as Human and social aspect which is not forgotten
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has members with experience in the industry. They are established in Africa , they should have a good knowledge of the market, the actors and local economy. It's a good thing to forge partnerships.
The budget presented seems to me perhaps a little undersized. Depend of the hourly cost of resources I guess. The costs should be detailed by following the milestones and roadmap set in order to be more precise.
f6_assessments.q2:
The list of deliverables and milestones are clear and very well developed. KPIs are achievable.
An assessment of the project can be done during development phase. 
The idea of sharing expenses in an open file is a very good thing that all other proposals should take inspiration from.
The risks are presented but not developed. The risks associated with the monetary value of recycling plastic for a given quantity should be developed.
Also about how to develop partnerships in the countries listed. What potential brakes exist? What measures should be done to maximize the chances of adoption?
